text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with three being a meatless chili i
used to call it vegetarian chili but
apparently there's some like rennet in
the cheese and that's from cows and you
know these vegetarians and their rules
so anyway we're going to do a simple
vegetarian whoops we're going to do a
simple meatless chili so i'm going to
sweat in a couple tablespoons of olive
oil 1 onion diced when those are nice
and soft after about five or six minutes
starting to get translucent i'm going to
put in two cloves of crushed garlic give
that a stir
alright i don't want to burn the garlic
my heats on medium-low i'm going to add
some cumin some ancho chili powder some
chipotle spicy smoked jalapeno chili
powder a little pinch of oregano alright
little bit of salt and we're going to
give that a little stir in the hot oil
kind of wake up the spices I'm going to
add a cup of tomato sauce you can use
tomato puree nothing with any weird you
know Italian seasonings in it which is
basic tomato sauce three cups of water
we're going to give that a stir and
we're going to bring that to a simmer
you can turn the heat up to medium-high
and I'm going to drain three cans of
beans I have the Holy Trinity of chili
beans in my opinion kidney black and
pinto I'm also going to add one pound of
frozen sweet corn thawed and drained I'm
going to diced jalapeno and a diced red
bell pepper
we're going to add our beans according
to this mixture go to stir and then
bring it up to a simmer on medium high
heat
reduce to medium-low and we're going to
simmer that about 20 minutes and it
looks like that then we're to use a
trick we used in our bumble bee soup
we're going to take a potato masher and
we're going to crush some of the beans
against the bottom of the pot to give
this Chile a beautiful thicker richer
texture all right how much you do is up
to you I just do it for a couple minutes
here and you'll see see that it's like a
nice thickness to it the more you smash
the thicker it gets and that's pretty
much it I'm going to cook it for another
10 or 15 minutes on medium low until
everything just is tasting beautiful you
want to taste this you want to give it
some salt if it needs it you want to
give us some pepper we're going to serve
that up piping hot in a bowl as opposed
to a plate and we're going to top with
some grated Jack cheese and if you want
to keep going you got your cilantro your
onions your you know how a pan you know
your sour cream your guacamole and your
tortilla chips or whatever you want to
serve on this anyway that's a basic
delicious beautiful meatless chili don't
call vegetarian if you put the cheese on
anyway hope you give that try check out
the site got all the ingredients and as
always enjoy
